sp_widget.name: IT Health SysTrack (Chameleon)
sp_widget.script:
(function() { data.userCache = { "registeredTime": 1695848349934, "value": { "account": 101552, "email": "YallalingLaxman.Khetagoudar@stefanini.com", "fqdn": "3LWWVL3.TECHTEAM.COM", "fullname": "updatemax": 0, "updatemin": 0, "updatesum": 0, "virtavg": 0, "virtcostavg": 0, "virtcostmax": 0, "virtcostmin": 0, "virtcostsum": 0, "virtmax": 0, "virtmin": 0, "virtsum": 0, "vmavg": 0, "vmcostavg": 0, "vmcostmax": 0, "vmcostmin": 0, "vmcostsum": 0, "vmmax": 0, "vmmin": 0, "vmsum": 0 }, "sensors": [ { "description": { "app": 0, "descParameters": [ { "maxLength": 30, "name": "BATTERY", "type": "String" }, { "name": "REMAINING_CHARGE", "precision": 0, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "BAT_STATUS", "type": "String" }, { "maxLength": 300, "name": "MEASURED1", "type": "String" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "ALM_ITEM1", "type": "String" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "ALM_INST1", "type": "String" }, { "name": "BatteryChargeCapacityThreshold", "precision": 0, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" } ], "levels": [ { "details": [ { "parameters": [ "MEASURED1" ], "text": "@{MEASURED1}" }, { "parameters": [ "BATTERY", "REMAINING_CHARGE" ], "text": "@{BATTERY} has a remaining charge capacity of @{REMAINING_CHARGE} % of the designed capacity." }, { "parameters": [ "BAT_STATUS" ], "text": "The current status of the battery is @{BAT_STATUS}" } ], "header": "Issues related to the battery status and health have been observed. This could lead to poor system performance, shorter time that the system can be away from AC power, and other system issues. This could be a sign the battery may need replacing.

\n\nTriggered when at least one of three conditions have been met: at least 5 occurrences of event 524 from the Microsoft Windows Kernel Power event source in the past four hours, a battery status that indicates degraded performance, or when the full charge capacity as a percent of the design capacity drops below the variable System_BatteryChargeCapacity_Low. ", "level": 1 } ] }, "detail": "Issues related to the battery status and health have been observed. This could lead to poor system performance, shorter time that the system can be away from AC power, and other system issues. This could be a sign the battery may need replacing.

\n\nTriggered when at least one of three conditions have been met: at least 5 occurrences of event 524 from the Microsoft Windows Kernel Power event source in the past four hours, a battery status that indicates degraded performance, or when the full charge capacity as a percent of the design capacity drops below the variable System_BatteryChargeCapacity_Low. ", "icon_color": "red", "icon_image": null, "main_value": 70, "main_variable": "BatteryChargeCapacityThreshold", "payload": [ { "BATTERY": "Portable Battery", "LS_ID": "BATTERY:Portable Battery", "REMAINING_CHARGE": -0.0017241379310344827 }, { "BAT_STATUS": "Unavailable", "LS_ID": "BAT_STATUS:Unavailable" }, { "BatteryChargeCapacityThreshold": 70, "LS_ID": "BatteryChargeCapacityThreshold" } ], "priority": "1", "sensor_id": "5580616e-46be-469d-a35e-f562f990c875", "sensor_name": "Possible Battery Issues", "severity": 6, "target": 100, "title": "Percent of remaining battery charge as per designed capacity.", "titleFormatter": "Percent of remaining battery charge as per designed capacity." }, { "description": { "app": 0, "descParameters": [ { "name": "UpDays", "precision": 0, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" }, { "name": "Days_Since_Last_Reboot", "precision": 0, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" } ], "levels": [ { "details": [ { "parameters": [ "UpDays" ], "text": "Last Reboot @{UpDays} Days Ago\n\n" }, { "parameters": [ "Days_Since_Last_Reboot" ], "text": "A delay in rebooting a system can cause performance issues. Ensure your system is rebooted every @{Days_Since_Last_Reboot} day(s)." } ], "header": "", "level": 1 } ] }, "detail": "Please be aware of the number of days that have passed since your last PC restart, as it has been a significant duration since your system was last refreshed. To ensure that your computer functions efficiently and securely, it's highly recommended that you initiate a restart at your earliest convenience. By doing so, you'll allow critical updates, enhancements, and security patches to be applied, thereby maintaining the health and performance of your system. Your cooperation in this matter is greatly appreciated, as it contributes to a smoother and more secure computing experience.", "icon_color": "red", "icon_image": null, "main_value": 10, "main_variable": "Days_Since_Last_Reboot", "payload": [ { "LS_ID": "UpDays", "UpDays": 13.841637757613428 }, { "Days_Since_Last_Reboot": 10, "LS_ID": "Days_Since_Last_Reboot" } ], "priority": "1", "sensor_id": "f29b932b-a2da-42de-9c16-5901936a949c", "sensor_name": "Reboot Status", "severity": 3, "target": null, "title": "Days since you last restarted your PC.
Please restart to apply the latest updates.", "titleFormatter": "Days since you last restarted your PC.
Please restart to apply the latest updates." }, { "description": { "app": 0, "descParameters": [ { "name": "AvgResponseTime", "precision": 2, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "CLADDR", "type": "String" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "AppName", "type": "String" }, { "name": "Application_LatencyMS_High", "precision": 2, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" } ], "levels": [ { "details": [ { "parameters": [ "AppName", "AvgResponseTime", "CLADDR" ], "text": "@{AppName} has an average latency of @{AvgResponseTime} ms to @{CLADDR} in the last day. " } ], "header": "Microsoft Teams is showing high latency values which could be impacting user experience. Use the Connections information in Black Box to see applications with active network connections and the associated latency. Use the Dependencies page to visualize latency averages.

\n\nTriggered when the average ping response time for Microsoft Teams over the past day exceeds the variable threshold Application_LatencyMS_High. ", "level": 1 }, { "details": [ { "parameters": [ "AppName", "AvgResponseTime", "CLADDR" ], "text": "@{AppName} has an average latency of @{AvgResponseTime} ms to @{CLADDR} in the last day. " } ], "header": "Microsoft Teams is showing high latency values which could be impacting user experience. Use the Connections information in Black Box to see applications with active network connections and the associated latency. Use the Dependencies page to visualize latency averages.

\n\nTriggered when the average ping response time for Microsoft Teams over the past day exceeds the variable threshold Application_LatencyMS_High. ", "level": 6 } ] }, "detail": "Microsoft Teams is showing high latency values which could be impacting user experience. Use the Connections information in Black Box to see applications with active network connections and the associated latency. Use the Dependencies page to visualize latency averages.

\n\nTriggered when the average ping response time for Microsoft Teams over the past day exceeds the variable threshold Application_LatencyMS_High. ", "icon_color": "red", "icon_image": "data:image/png;base64,", "main_value": null, "main_variable": null, "payload": [ { "AppName": "teams.exe", "AvgResponseTime": 348, "CLADDR": "52.114.144.90", "LS_ID": "AppName:teams.exe" }, { "Application_LatencyMS_High": 300, "LS_ID": "Application_LatencyMS_High" } ], "priority": "0", "sensor_id": "51064f37-9006-4a3e-8a4e-48befa0c8fc3", "sensor_name": "Teams Latency Impact", "severity": 3, "target": null, "title": "Microsoft Teams is showing high latency values which could be impacting user experience.", "titleFormatter": "Microsoft Teams is showing high latency values which could be impacting user experience." }, { "description": { "app": 0, "descParameters": [ { "format": "DateTime", "name": "PingTime", "type": "DateTime" }, { "name": "ResponseTime", "precision": 2, "scale": 1, "type": "Number" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "ClientAddress", "type": "String" }, { "maxLength": 30, "name": "ApplicationName", "type": "String" } ], "levels": [ { "details": [ { "parameters": [ "PingTime", "ApplicationName", "ResponseTime", "ClientAddress" ], "text": "At @{PingTime}, @{ApplicationName} had a latency of @{ResponseTime} ms to the client address @{ClientAddress}." } ], "header": "Local Security Authority Subsystem Service is a process in Microsoft Windows operating systems that is responsible for enforcing the security policy on the system. It verifies users logging on to a Windows computer or server, handles password changes, and creates access tokens. Lsass resides in the %windir%\\system32 directory. If the process is running from any other directory it could indicate a malware issue.

Use the \"View Process Tree\" option to determine the path the application is being run from. If it is anything other than %windir%\\system32, stop the process and restart from the system32 directory.

Use the Connections dataset to review application latency information, if most or all applications are experiencing high latency, you may want to restart networking.

\n\nTriggered when the latency for lsass.exe exceeds the variable DomainContoller_LantecyMS_High. ", "level": 1 }, { "details": [], "header": "Local Security Authority Subsystem Service is a process in Microsoft Windows operating systems that is responsible for enforcing the security policy on the system. It verifies users logging on to a Windows computer or server, handles password changes, and creates access tokens. Lsass resides in the %windir%\\system32 directory. If the process is running from any other directory it could indicate a malware issue.

Use the \"View Process Tree\" option to determine the path the application is being run from. If it is anything other than %windir%\\system32, stop the process and restart from the system32 directory.

Use the Connections dataset to review application latency information, if most or all applications are experiencing high latency, you may want to restart networking.

\n\nTriggered when the latency for lsass.exe exceeds the variable DomainContoller_LantecyMS_High. ", "level": 3 } ] }, "detail": "Local Security Authority Subsystem Service is a process in Microsoft Windows operating systems that is responsible for enforcing the security policy on the system. It verifies users logging on to a Windows computer or server, handles password changes, and creates access tokens. Lsass resides in the %windir%\\system32 directory. If the process is running from any other directory it could indicate a malware issue.

Use the \"View Process Tree\" option to determine the path the application is being run from. If it is anything other than %windir%\\system32, stop the process and restart from the system32 directory.

Use the Connections dataset to review application latency information, if most or all applications are experiencing high latency, you may want to restart networking.

\n\nTriggered when the latency for lsass.exe exceeds the variable DomainContoller_LantecyMS_High. ", "icon_color": "red", "icon_image": null, "main_value": 221, "main_variable": "ResponseTime", "payload": [ { "ApplicationName": "lsass.exe", "ClientAddress": "172.17.16.50", "LS_ID": "ApplicationName:lsass.exe", "PingTime": 1695814547, "ResponseTime": 221 } ], "priority": "1", "sensor_id": "f91c39f5-c8ef-4f03-bcb0-a3006576cfd8", "sensor_name": "High Domain Controller Latency", "severity": 6, "target": 0.5, "title": "Milliseconds of latency from the @{ApplicationName} to the client address.", "titleFormatter": "Milliseconds of latency from the lsass.exe to the client address." } ], "sysname": "3LWWVL3", "upn": "ykhetago@techteam.com", "username": "TTGLOBAL\\YKHETAGO" } }; return; //--------------------------------------- //Get current user's email var gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user'); gr.get(gs.getUserID()); //var userEmail = gr.email; var userEmail = 'yallalinglaxman.khetagoudar@stefanini.com'; var cacheKey = 'ithealth-systrack-' + userEmail; var cacheExpiryTime = 1;//800000; //30 minutes var cacheLimitExpiryTime = 86400000; //24 hours var compareCacheTime = new Date().getTime() - cacheExpiryTime; var limitCacheTime = new Date().getTime() - cacheLimitExpiryTime; data.userCache = JSON.parse(gs.getSession().getClientData(cacheKey)); //It has cache... if(data.userCache) { //...and is less than 30 minutes, give that back. if(data.userCache.registeredTime > compareCacheTime) { data.SystrackUser = data.userCache.value; return; } //Limit time to clear cache if(data.userCache.registeredTime < limitCacheTime) { data.userCache = null; } } //It will just follow if it has no cache or is expired. var sysTrackSensors = []; var dateScore = new Date(new Date().setHours(new Date().getHours() -3)).toISOString(); var startDate = new Date(new Date().setHours(new Date().getHours() -24)).toISOString(); var endDate = new Date().toISOString(); //Get token to authenticate to SysTrack var request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2('x_stefa_chameleon.D3 Lakeside Systrack', 'Authentication'); var req = getRequest(request); data.token = req ? req.access_token : null; if (!data.token) return; //Get SysTrack user's data request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2('x_stefa_chameleon.D3 Lakeside Systrack', 'User'); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('accessToken', data.token); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('email', userEmail); req = getRequest(request); data.SystrackUser = req ? req.data[0] : null; if (!data.SystrackUser) { data.SystrackUser = data.userCache ? data.userCache.value : {'scores': null}; return; } //Get SysTrack complete User's data request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2('x_stefa_chameleon.D3 Lakeside Systrack', 'User System'); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('accessToken', data.token); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('account', data.SystrackUser.account); req = getRequest(request); var user = req ? req.data[0] : null; if (!user) return; data.SystrackUser.guid = user.guid; data.SystrackUser.fqdn = user.fqdn; data.SystrackUser.sysname = user.name; data.SystrackUser.status = user.status; //Get SysTrack Health Score request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2('x_stefa_chameleon.D3 Lakeside Systrack', 'Health Score'); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('accessToken', data.token); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('userGuid', data.SystrackUser.guid); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('startDate', dateScore); req = getRequest(request); data.SystrackUser.scores = req ? req.data[0] : null; if (!data.SystrackUser.scores) { data.SystrackUser = data.userCache ? data.userCache.value : data.SystrackUser; return; } //Get list of monitored sensors data.SystrackUser.sensors = []; try { gr = new GlideRecord('x_stefa_chameleon_it_health_sensors'); gr.query(); while(gr.next()){ data.SystrackUser.sensors.push({ 'sensor_name': gr.getValue('sensor_name'), 'sensor_id': gr.getValue('sensor_id'), 'priority': gr.getValue('priority'), 'main_variable': gr.getValue('main_variable'), 'target': parseFloat(gr.getValue('target')) || null, 'title': gr.getValue('title'), 'icon_image': gr.getValue('icon_image'), 'icon_color': gr.getValue('icon_color') }); } } catch(ex) { $sp.log('Get list of monitored sensors - ' + ex.getMessage()); } //Get SysTrack List Sensors request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2('x_stefa_chameleon.D3 Lakeside Systrack', 'Sensors'); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('accessToken', data.token); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('userGuid', data.SystrackUser.guid); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('startTime', startDate); request.setStringParameterNoEscape('endTime', endDate); req = getRequest(request); var sensors = req ? req.data : []; if(sensors && sensors.length > 0) { sysTrackSensors = sensors.reduce(function(accumulator, current) { if (!accumulator.find(function(item) {return item.SensorId === current.SensorId})) { accumulator.push(current); } return accumulator; }, []); } //Sensors that only the customer has data.SystrackUser.sensors = data.SystrackUser.sensors.filter(function(item) { return sysTrackSensors.filter(function(s) {return s.SensorId === item.sensor_id}).length > 0; }); data.SystrackUser.sensors = data.SystrackUser.sensors.map(function(item) { var sysItem = sysTrackSensors.filter(function(s) {return s.SensorId === item.sensor_id})[0]; item.payload = sysItem.Payload ? JSON.parse(sysItem.Payload).payload.rows : null; item.main_value = item.main_variable ? item.payload.filter(function(s) {return s[item.main_variable]})[0][item.main_variable] : null; item.severity = sysItem.Severity; item.description = sysItem.Descriptions[0]; item.detail = removeInternalLink(item.description.levels[0].header); item.titleFormatter = titleFormatter(item.title, item.payload); return item; }); //Order by Priority and Severity data.SystrackUser.sensors.sort(function(a, b) { //Priority if ( a.priority > b.priority ) return -1; if ( a.priority < b.priority ) return 1; //Severity if ( a.severity > b.severity ) return -1; if ( a.severity < b.severity ) return 1; return 0; }); data.userCache = setUserCache(cacheKey, data.SystrackUser); //$sp.log(data.SystrackUser); function setUserCache(key, value) { const item = { value: value, registeredTime: new Date().getTime() } gs.getSession().putClientData(key, JSON.stringify(item)); return item; } function titleFormatter(title, payload) { payload.forEach(function(item) { var attrs = Object.keys(item); for(var i = 0; i < attrs.length; i++) { if(!title.includes(getKey(attrs[i]))) continue; if(attrs[i].toLowerCase().includes('time')) { var d = new Date(item[attrs[i]] * 1000); item[attrs[i]] = d.getMonth()+1+'/'+ d.getDate()+'/'+ d.getFullYear(); } title = title.replace(getKey(attrs[i]), item[attrs[i]]); } }); return title; } function getKey(key) { return '@{' + key + '}'; } function removeInternalLink(text) { var linkRx = /]*?\s+)?href=?\"\/(.*?)\">(.*?)<\/a>/g; var tagRx = //g; var links = text.match(linkRx); if(links && links.length > 0) { text.match(linkRx).forEach(function(link) { var after = link.replace(tagRx,'').replace('', ''); text = text.replace(link, after); }); } return text; } function getRequest(req) { try { var response = req.execute(); return response.getStatusCode() == 200 ? JSON.parse(response.getBody()) : null; } catch(ex){ $sp.log('Get Request - ' + ex.getMessage()); return null; } } })();
sp_widget.template:
${YOUR IT HEALTH}

You don't have sensors on alert.

${Last update}: {{c.data.userCache.registeredTime | date: 'MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm a'}} ${See details}
${Device X-Ray}

${Health Score is Unavailable}

${The system is unable to retrieve your IT Health Score.}
${Usually this is because your device is turned off. If that is not the case, please contact the Service Desk.}
X

${User not found}

${Please make sure the user has a registered account in Lakeside Systrack.}
